The MeasurementArray Object¶

When making a series of Measurements that need to be grouped together (i.e. for plotting or group calculations) a MeasurementArray should be used. This section describes the uses of MeasurementArray objects.

qexpy.error.MeasurementArray(data, error=None, name=None, units=None, error_method='Derivative')[source]¶

Function to easily construct a Measurement_Array object. It is better to call this function and let it create the Measurement_Array object behind the scenes.

Parameters:
  • error (constant, array) – Either a single value representing the error on all the Measurements in the MeasurementArray, or a list of errors corresponding to all the Measurements in the MeasurementArray.
  • name (str) – A string of the name of the MeasurementArray.
  • units (str) – A string of the units of the MeasurementArray.
  • error_method (str) – Which method to use when propagating errors through calculations on the MeasurementArray. Can be ‘Monte Carlo’, ‘Min Max’ or’Derivative’
Returns:

A Measurement_Array object.
Return type:

Measurement_Array
class qexpy.error.Measurement_Array[source]¶

A numpy-based array of Measurement objects. It is better to call MeasurementArray() and let it create a Measurement_Array object behind the scenes.

append(meas)[source]¶

Appends a value to the end of a MeasurementArray.

Parameters:meas (Measurement, constant) – A measurement to be appended to the MeasurementArray.
Returns:A MeasurementArray with the new value added to the end.
Return type:Measurement_Array
delete(pos)[source]¶

Removes an element from a MeasurementArray.

Parameters:pos (int) – The 0-indexed position in the MeasurementArray of the Measurement that will be deleted. Must be between 0 and the length of the MeasurementArray.
Returns:A MeasurementArray with the Measurement at the specified position removed.
Return type:Measurement_Array
error_method¶

Gets the method (Monte Carlo, derivative or min max) used to calculate error of a MeasurementArray object.

Returns:A string of the error propagation method specified for the Measurement object.
Return type:str
error_weighted_mean¶

Gets the error weighted mean and error of a MeasurementArray. The error weighted mean gives more weight to more precise Measurements.

Returns:The weighted mean of all the Measurements in the MeasurementArray.
Return type:tuple
get_units_str()[source]¶

Generates a string representation of the units.

Returns:A string representation of the units of the MeasurementArray.
Return type:str
insert(pos, meas)[source]¶

Inserts a value in a position in a MeasurementArray.

Parameters:
  • pos (int) – The 0-indexed position in the MeasurementArray that the measurement will be inserted into. Must be between 0 and the length of the MeasurementArray.
  • meas (Measurement, constant) – A measurement to be inserted into the MeasurementArray.
Returns:

A MeasurementArray with the new value inserted into the position specified by the pos parameter.
Return type:

Measurement_Array
mean¶

Gets the mean of the means of the Measurements in the MeasurementArray.

Returns:The mean of the means of all the Measurements in the MeasurementArray.
Return type:numpy.ndarray
means¶

Returns a numpy array with the means of each value in the MeasurementArray, as calculated by the method (der, MC, MinMax).

Returns:A numpy array of the means of the Measurements in the MeasurementArray.
Return type:numpy.ndarray
set_units(units=None)[source]¶

Sets the units of a MeasurementArray.

Parameters:units (str) – The units of the MeasurementArray.
std(ddof=1)[source]¶

Calculates the standard deviation of the means of all the Measurements in the MeasurementArray.

Parameters:ddof (int) – The degrees of freedom of the MeasurementArray.
Returns:The standard deviation of the means of all the Measurements in the MeasurementArray.
Return type:numpy.ndarray
stds¶

Returns a numpy array with the standard deviations of each value in the MeasurementArray, as calculated by the method (der, MC, MinMax).

Returns:A numpy array of the standard deviations of the Measurements in the MeasurementArray.
Return type:numpy.ndarray
